content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.67 - Executive order no. 67: establishing the position of director of housing

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the State of New York faces a critical shortage of
nearly one million decent affordable housing units; and
WHEREAS, a multi-billion dollar program to expand and
improve our housing stock is currently being implemented; and
WHEREAS, it is necessary to develop a coordinated effort by
the State's housing agencies to ensure that the State's housing needs are
met; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York, do hereby establish the position of Director of

Housing. I. Powers and

Responsibilities

The Director of Housing shall advise and assist the

Governor in the development and implementation of policies and programs to
increase the production of decent, affordable housing. In reaching this
objective, the director shall: (1)
create a strong, centralized administrative structure to ensure that the
programs of the Division of Housing and Community Renewal, the New York State

Housing Finance Agency, the State of New York Mortgage Agency and other State
agencies and public corporations involved in housing are coordinated; (2)
develop a coherent, unified State housing
policy based on multi-year projections of needs; (3)
identify specific program initiatives and
methods to combine the resources of government and the public and private
sectors in order to increase the production of affordable housing; (4)
make recommendations for the expansion of
opportunities for homeownership based on successful models like the New York

City Partnership's New Homes program and East Brooklyn's Nehemiah Plan
homes; (5)
conduct a comprehensive
review and evaluation of the State's rent regulation system and submit by

December 1, 1986 recommendations for changes and improvements; (6)
be responsible for overseeing the
supervision, direction and management of the State's housing programs and
projects to assure their timely implementation and operation; (7)
advise the Governor concerning Federal
policies and actions that may affect the State's housing stock; and
(8)
be the Governor's chief spokesperson in
the area of housing. II. Assistance to the Director

All appropriate departments, divisions, boards, offices and
public corporations of the State shall provide such assistance as the director
may require for the effective discharge of his responsibilities. Such
assistance may include, but need not be limited to, the use of agency staff, the provision of statistical and policy data in such form as is determined by
the director and consultation with agency staff as the director shall
require. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: June 5, 1985
